alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Kanawha; Lewis; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 3:34PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Calhoun, central Nicholas, northeastern Kanawha, Gilmer, west central Lewis, Braxton, southeastern Roane, northwestern Webster and Clay Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 334 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Arnoldsburg, or 12 miles south of Grantsville, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Glenville, Sutton, Clay, Gassaway, Camden-On-gauley, Birch River, Arnoldsburg, Cedar Creek State Park, Big Otter, Camden On Gauley, Wallback, Amma, Craigsville, Harrison, Cowen, Burnsville, Flatwoods, Sand Fork and Little Birch. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 19 and 84. Route 19 between mile markers 42 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Kanawha; Lewis; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Roane
